channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: World's biggest chipmaker TSMC posts record 2024 revenue as AI boost continues
item.description: TSMC manufacturers semiconductors for some of the world's biggest companies from Apple to Nvidia.

item.title: Corona brewer gets slammed post-earnings, and we question whether to keep the stock
item.description: This was not the quarter we were looking for — and unfortunately, we see little reason to defend Constellation brands.

item.title: Planet Fitness Is Keeping Its Resolutions
item.description: The gym chain’s revamp has taken hold after a franchisee revolt.

item.title: Delta outlook tops estimates as CEO expects 2025 to be airline's 'best financial year in our history'
item.description: Delta's CEO said strong travel demand is driving revenue higher.

item.title: Macquarie to Invest Up to $5 Billion in Applied Digital AI Data Centers
item.description: The deal follows strong investor interest in businesses connected to the AI boom.

item.title: U.S. Sanctions on Russian LNG Could Pose Risks to Europe
item.description: U.S. sanctions against the operators of two Russian liquefied-natural-gas terminals will have a limited impact on global prices but pose supply risks ...

item.title: This Year Could Be Tales of Two Stories for U.S. Dollar
item.description: The U.S. dollar index was weaker, and UBS said 2025 could be a story of two halves for the currency, with strength in the first half turning into a pa...

item.title: Walgreens shares soar 27% on big earnings beat, as drugstore chain cuts costs
item.description: Walgreens maintained its fiscal 2025 adjusted earnings guidance, but did not include a sales outlook in its release.

item.title: Copper's Outlook Pressured by Trump Policies, BMI Says
item.description: Copper was stronger, but its outlook is clouded by expectations of a stronger dollar, looming tariffs and a potential deceleration in the energy trans...

item.title: Retailers post early holiday results — and Wall Street isn’t impressed
item.description: Lululemon, Abercrombie & Fitch and American Eagle all hiked their holiday guidance, but Abercrombie's growth is slowing.
